poem:
Title: "The Silent Song of Wye"

Beloved Wye, where we as children played,
Strangled at the yield and greed of trade.
Silenced truth marries the banker's tune,
Tarnished are the ripples under flaming June.
Corporate quills refrain the honest call,
Whole-hearted hush in the hall of all.
Our river, now a tortured verse,
In Tesco's purse, each pound's reverse.
